arts.ttl: Wrexham boost promotion dream with Blackpool win as Rob McElhenney watches on
arts.sum: Phil Parkinson's side are now second in the League One table after beating Blackpool 2-1

arts.ttl: McClean sparks Wrexham victory at Blackpool to boost promotion dream
arts.sum: The Championship may have to start preparing for Hollywood. A third successive promotion remains firmly in Wrexham’s sights after a near-perfect day for them in League One’s tumultuous automatic promotion race. Who writes their scripts? While their rivals Wycombe crumbled to a 4-0 home defeat by Charlton to topple out of the top two, Wrexham took full advantage, overpowering Blackpool with a dominant second-half display capped by quick-fire goals from James McClean and Ollie Rathbone. Behind the champions Birmingham, the Welsh club are two points better off than the Chairboys on 86, with Charlton on 82 and Stockport, who beat Huddersfield, on 81. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Wrexham boost promotion hopes with victory at Blackpool
arts.sum: Club co-owner Rob McElhenney was present to see the second-half goals which clinched victory.

arts.ttl: Monday's League One predictions including Blackpool vs. Wrexham
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's League One fixtures, including Blackpool vs. Wrexham.

Blackpool might be six points behind the playoffs, but their game in hand means they remain very much in the picture. But the Seasiders will most likely have to win all of their four remaining games ...
